item.title: CHIN1 Elementary Modern Chinese
item.description:
Role: Teaching Fellow

Term: Fall 2020

Location: Department of Asian Languages and Cultures, University of California, Los Angeles

Course Description:

  • Greet people with proper titles
  • Count numbers
  • Basic structure of Chinese characters
  • Phonetic symbols of Chinese

item.title: CHIN2 Elementary Modern Chinese
item.description:
Role: Teaching Fellow

Term: Fall 2020

Location: Department of Asian Languages and Cultures, University of California, Los Angeles

Course Description:

  • Express different tenses by using different sentence structures
  • Short converstation in different scenarios such as subway station, restaurant, etc.
  • Advanced verbs and nouns in Chinese

item.title: C&EE 241 Advanced Steel Structures
item.description:
Role: Teaching Assistant

Term: Spring 2019, Spring 2020

Location: Department of Civil & Environmental Engineering, University of California, Los Angeles

Course Description:

  • Composite beam design
  • Floor vibration
  • Seismic loading
  • Moment frame design
  • Eccentrically braced frame
  • Concentrically braced frame
  • Buckling restrained braced frame
  • Steel plate shear walls

item.title: C&EE 235 Advanced Structural Analysis
item.description:
Role: Teaching Fellow

Term: Fall 2018, Fall 2019

Location: Department of Civil & Environmental Engineering, University of California, Los Angeles

Course Description:

  • Understand essential concepts of structural analysis: equilibrium, compatibility, static determinacy and indeterminacy, 1st or 2nd order elastic analysis, etc.
  • Analyze statically loaded structures using various methods: direct stiffness method, flexibility method, principle of virtual forces, and principle of virtual displacements.
  • Impelement stiffness method using computer programming.
  • Analyze structures’ response to thermal and self-straining (pre-stressing) loads.

item.title: C&EE 144 Structural System Design
item.description:
Role: Teaching Assistant

Term: Spring 2018

Institution: Department of Civil & Environmental Engineering, University of California, Los Angeles

Course Description:

  • Provide an overview of building structural systems and their performance
  • Gain familiarity with building codes and their implementation
  • Acquire basic knowledge for evaluating, selecting, and designing building structural systems
  • Acquire basic knowledge for preparing and presenting structural designs for buildings
